name: The Westin Georgetown, Washington D.C.

reviews.title: Nice westin, pretty pricey
reviews.text: This is a nice Westin, my room was spacious and had a balcony (shared w/ other rooms) that looked out on the street. Check-in & out was easy, bathroom was large and had a tub & a separate shower. The hotel was a little pricey though. My room was $255/night, +$37/taxes, +$25/parking. More than I expected it to be.

Good location close to the subway and within an easy walk to Dupont Circle and a reasonable walk to the White House. Spacious two bed room with large bathroom (separate water closet, soaker tub, double-headed shower, and bathrobes.) In-room safe, ironing board and iron. Friendly service and clean. What more can you ask for?
reviews.title: No complaints here!

reviews.text: stayed there for two night over the weekend. great hotel, good staff, location was excellent, short walk to George town and to the Mall, close to metro.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got this place for $68 on Priceline for 2 nights (August 2-4). Called the day before to confirm reservation. Because of priceline, they couldn't give me the type of room until we checked in. We got a room with a king bed overlooking the city. This was a pefect room for my wife and I.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.text: The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was great! The staff was very friendly and the hotel just had a very fresh feel (didn't have any kind of musty or mildew smell that some hotels do).
reviews.title: The Best Hotel

likes.disliked: — When I checked in they gave me an already-occupied room, but fixed it quickly

reviews.text: The hotel was nice enough. The room was spacious and the bathroom was very nice.The only thing is it wasn't a very big hotel as the name might lead you to believe.The lobby was very small and the outdoor entrance was even smaller. They had started to remodel the entrance a couple of days before we left on July 8th, 2010. They had nice fresh fruit and nice cold water for the guests which was a welcome after a day of sightseeing. No concierge in sight. I like hotels on a grander scale.
reviews.title: Not so grand.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was in great location, close to metro and walking distance to other areas. The hotel was clean and service was friendly.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: We were cautious of this hotel since we got it for dirt cheap on Priceline. The hotel was in the perfect location. It was nice, the staff was friendly and the bathroom was amazing. If I had to choose one drawback it would be the upcharge for things like wifi but I think that is pretty standard. It is attached to a pay per park garage at $34 a night. Pretty great deal in D.C. We loved it and would stay again for sure.
reviews.title: Great Fall Stay

reviews.text: For the price I was surprised by the lack of amenities. Great location but there was no restaurant late night or early morning. I had to check in at 8 or so and out by 6:30am the next day, so there was nothing available. In the room you have a mini bar, but prices are extraordinary. Luckily you can walk to places nearby. The parking is good but not free. I agree with others, it was clean and the bathroom / showers were very cool.
reviews.title: great location, but..

reviews.text: I've stayed here twice a yr. each yr. that my daughter was at GWU. The last time I stayed there was for her graduation and I knew it would probably be the last. The beds are extremely comfortable. The location is fantastic to Georgetown shopping or to Foggy Bottom. The bathrooms are spacious as is the closet. I also enjoy the lobby - it's comfortable to people watch or wait for your friends and family to arrive.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: My recent stay at the Westin Georgetown was everything I expected from a Westin. It really exceeded my expectiations. The hotel was beautifully decorated, welcoming, accommodating, clean and quiet.
reviews.title: Everything a traveler and guest should expect and more!

reviews.text: The entire staff I encountered was courteous, happy and quick to accommodate. You are always greeted by the staff no matter when they see you or the hour. The Staff's attention to details regarding guest accommodations and request is more than impressive.
reviews.title: Great location, very friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Valet staff never let me touch a bag or a door. They always remembered and called me by my name and also made sure as a woman, I felt secure and safe. They were always conscious and concerned about my safety and as a result, I felt safe and secure.
reviews.title: Great location & service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotels food menu had a wonderfuls assortment of food items that were absolutely delicious. Food was prepared fresh everytime and server hot and timely in the resturant and
reviews.title: Great Rooms and Customer Service
Visiting Georgetown
reviews.text: to the room by room service.

I stayed here with my wife for our anniversary last year. Classic starwood property with all the service and amenities one would expect. Great staff, clean large rooms and a pretty good location. Highly recommended for business and pleasure travelers.
reviews.title: Great Westin property

reviews.text: The hotel is well manicured, with impeccable rooms! The bathroom spacious with an amazing double shower head. The staff are on the point. We were greeted with smiles and a great help and assitance when needed. The location is perfect, walking distance to the metro and Georgetown and cabs are always standing ready to take you anywhere further. Overall great experience. Will be back soon!
reviews.title: All around best place to stay in DC!

reviews.text: Deenny is absolutely the best!! Also very much like Kate, one of the reservationists.
reviews.title: I Love This Hotel!

reviews.text: Due to a family medical emergency I had to fly to DC. I walked into the Westin and asked them if they had a room because they were close to the hospital. I told them I didn't know how long I would need to stay. They told me not to worry that they would have a room for me as long as I needed it. Everyone at the hotel was very caring and always checking in with me everyday to see if they could do anything for me. I would like to give a big thanks to Vikram and Kevin who went above and beyond taking care of me during the week.
reviews.title: Unbelievable Caring Staff

reviews.text: I frequent DC and this hotel is on the quieter side of town and also safe. Sits next to Ritz, Park Hyatt & Fairmount-- 2 blocks to Georgetown strip. They keep rooms very updated and nice. I have been going here for over 10 years.
reviews.title: About the people- good service
Great Location clean and friendly hotel.
reviews.text: I love the location of this hotel. close to everything.

reviews.title: Great hotel, good location (3/11 - 3/14)
reviews.text: it is with in 4 blocks of Georgetown.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: close to both the Foggy Bottom (George Washington University metro stop) metro as well as DuPont Circle metro stop.
reviews.title: Great experience... Nice stay at Priceline price

likes.disliked: — internet costs $10, no free breakfast, parking is pricey (find a spot on the street!)

reviews.text: I found I enjoyed wallking because there were always interesting things to see.
reviews.title: Westin was wonderful

reviews.text: lots of shops close by as well as plenty of restaurants.
reviews.title: great location and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I "won" this hotel off a Priceline bid of $76 per night for 6/1-6/3. We arrived early Friday evening, although we had our doubts at first that we'd ever find it, but that was our own fault along with mapquest. My advice if you're driving and attempting to follow mapquest, is to ignore directions when you get into the city and just follow logical street letters and numbers. There's "k", go one over and there's "L", etc.
reviews.title: Loved the Westin!

likes.disliked: — Could've been a little closer to the metro. :)

reviews.text: Also, if you're parking your car at the Westin and don't intend to take it back out, so you don't need valet parking, parking is behind/on the side of the Westin and is a regular parking garage, so you don't need to check with the hotel first. We waited for awhile for valet to get through with other people first, before we asked about it, so we could've saved a little time, had we known. You might even be able to find street parking for free, but we didn't want to mess with it.
reviews.title: Exceptional Hotel

likes.disliked: — Expensive! (Maybe not for a hotel in Manhattan, but it was pricey)

reviews.text: Check-in was prompt and friendly. We headed up to our room, tried the key and it wouldn't open. Tried the other key. Nope. Hmmmmmm, checked the number again and realized we ( uh...I) might have misread his handwriting. Sure enough, off to another floor, tried a different room, and there we were. My apologies to anyone that might've been in that first room, if you were alarmed that someone was trying to get in.
reviews.title: Showing Wear

reviews.text: So, now that we sound like total idiots...can't follow mapquest, and attempting to get in the wrong room...I will say that our stay could not have been any nicer. This hotel is lovely! Candles lit the lobby, the room was delightful and large. The marble bathroom with separate toilet area was HUGE. The shower pressure was perfect and wonderful! Everything was clean and very very nice.
reviews.title: Good but not great

reviews.text: We were curious to find out what "Unwind" was, after our slightly stressful drive to get to DC, so we went downstairs to the bar area. They did have some drink specials listed, and my husband tried a "Democrat", which was very blue. I had a glass of wine. We had the place to ourselves on a Friday night. There was a nice lady giving out free hand massages, which we had to try and it was very relaxing. We, of course, tipped nicely for our "free" hand massages. The bartender was kind enough to give us a sample of some delicious spring rolls. YUM. We, of course, tipped nicely for that as well. A very relaxing place to unwind and start our weekend adventure in D.C.
reviews.title: liked very much

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really comfortable hotel, the rooms very very quiet and very tastefully decorated. The staff were very helpful. I would stay here again and recommend to all.
reviews.title: Great Location and Lovely Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel was is in a safe neighbourhood, great for see the city on foot. We prefer to walk and this hotel is a 10 min walk from the great restaurants at Dupont Circle, and 25 minutes from the White House or Lincoln Memorial. There are also handy Metro stops for connection to Union Station or The Capital.
reviews.title: AmaJoe, Erwing

reviews.text: Definitely try and fly into Reagan DCA Airport. It was a $25 cab fare to the hotel!
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.text: Great character, top notch can't beat it.
reviews.title: "Heavenly" and great location

reviews.text: quick, friendly, engaging made you feel like family
reviews.title: Georgetown Westin

reviews.text: We just got back from a Girl's Weekend in Washington D.C. where we stayed at the Westin Grand in Foggy Bottom/Georgetown. We arrived late on Friday and the hotel was full. Since we specificed 2 beds, we were upgraded to their balcony suite on the second floor overlooking the courtyard. It was a beautiful room, though it looked like someone had recently trashed it (stains on carpet, marks on walls). The hotel staff was ultra-courteous and helpful with dinner and nightlife suggestions and the location just east of Georgetown and 8 blocks from the White House was fantastic.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, needs some cleaning...

likes.liked: — Location and the balcony in our room.
likes.disliked: — Stains on carpet and marks on walls, looked like someone had a crazy party

reviews.text: First the good about this place- the heavenly bed is up to Westin standards. The workout room is nice, and the pool is a nice amenity. That's about it.
reviews.title: God awful

reviews.text: The bad- where to start? Every review I read of this place said it's in a great location, but nobody bothered to mention that there's a firehouse two blocks away. No exaggeration- they were called out 5 times every night of my stay. Impossible to sleep when you're on the second floor facing the street. Add to the sirens the drunks on the street all night and it makes for a miserable night. Upon checkin, the staff was surly at best (and I'm Starwood Platinum!) The concierge was a milquetoast, the valet service is horrendous- 1/2 to get your car. Room was outdated and bathroom needed a makeover big time.
reviews.title: Decent hotel, but in need of renovations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is just terrible- use your Starwood points or cash somewhere else. I am livid about wasting my time here.
reviews.title: GIVE THIS ONE A MISS - PLENTY OF OTHER GREAT PLACES TO STAY IN DC

reviews.text: My partner and I are frequent travelers to DC for work, and have stayed at the Westin Grand due to its convenience to our office. Overall, we have been disappointed by our recent experiences there. We enjoy Platinum status at Starwood because of our work travel, and were therefore supposed to get an upgraded room; however, our room was seriously lacking in terms of upkeep and amenities. Although the room and bathroom were very clean, the furniture was dated and the carpeting was fairly worn. The location of the TV cabinet/bureau in relation to the bed was such that it was very difficult to watch TV from the bed. Additionally, we had to call the hotel engineer to the room multiple times to fix the Internet connection box - in the end, it was never really fixed. Even though Service Express said that they would take the Internet charges off of the bill, they did not follow through. The bathroom was sizeable, with a single sink, separate tub, and (small) walkin Heavenly Shower.
reviews.title: Good hotel, good location

likes.liked: — Location within easy walking to Georgetown and Dupont Circle

aka: The Westin Georgetown, Washington d.c. Hotel Washington Dc
description: Convenient to Georgetown's shops and restaurants, Kennedy Center, Dupont Circle, and the White House, The Westin Georgetown, Washington D.C. is a refreshing choice for travel.
